text:
Singer Sona Mohapatra took to social media to slam singer Anu Malik, who came out in support of music director Anu Malik. Just to jog your memory a little, Sona and a few other women had accused Malik of sexual misconduct during the rise of #MeToo movement in India.
Reacting to how Sonu Nigam extended support to Anu Malik, she took to Twitter to write,
Pinterest
“So much sympathy for a millionaire losing work? So much empathy for his privileged family being ‘tortured’?How about the scores of girls & women he tortured?Multiple testimonies not proof enough?”
She added:
1)Not 1 but possibly 💯+ women & MEN can attest to Anu Malik’s deplorable abusive behaviour.
2)I guess Mr. Sonu Nigam expects all these women/underage girls to - a)strap recording devices b)carry spy cams,other proof gathering devices cus they have much to benefit defaming him? https://t.co/2udQ71S70a — SONA (@sonamohapatra) December 19, 2018
Don't Miss 362 SHARES 12.5 K SHARES 5.5 K SHARES 3.4 K SHARES 3.1 K SHARES
It was during the #MeToo movement in India that many who were in power in the film industry were called out for their inappropriate conduct. One of these men was Anu Malik, who was accused by several women of asking for sexual favours from women.
title: Sona Mohapatra Slams Sonu Nigam For Supporting Anu Malik During #MeToo Allegations
